title: FinancialUnitEnum
description: Provides enumerated values for financial units, generally used in the context of defining quantities for securities.

oneOf.title: Contract
oneOf.description: Denotes financial contracts, such as listed futures and options.

oneOf.title: ContractualProduct
oneOf.description: Denotes a Contractual Product as defined in the CDM.  This unit type would be used when the price applies to the whole product, for example, in the case of a premium expressed as a cash amount.

oneOf.title: IndexUnit
oneOf.description: Denotes a price expressed in index points, e.g. for a stock index.

oneOf.title: LogNormalVolatility
oneOf.description: Denotes a log normal volatility, expressed in %/month, where the percentage is represented as a decimal. For example, 0.15 means a log-normal volatility of 15% per month.

oneOf.title: Share
oneOf.description: Denotes the number of units of financial stock shares.

oneOf.title: ValuePerDay
oneOf.description: Denotes a value (expressed in currency units) for a one day change in a valuation date, which is typically used for expressing sensitivity to the passage of time, also known as theta risk, or carry, or other names.

oneOf.title: ValuePerPercent
oneOf.description: Denotes a value (expressed in currency units) per percent change in the underlying rate which is typically used for expressing sensitivity to volatility changes, also known as vega risk.

oneOf.title: Weight
oneOf.description: Denotes a quantity (expressed as a decimal value) represented the weight of a component in a basket.
